page.title: 02ARMY TESTING TRACK.
page.content: Covering land at the top of High Curley between Red Road and the M3 is an area owned by the Ministry of Defence which used to be known as the Military Vehicle Experimental Establ- ishment but which,under new government policies,has recently been renamed the Royal Armament Research & Development Establishment(R.A.R.D.E).On these Bagshot Test Tracks,covering an area of approximately six square kilometres military vehicles are tested and deve- loped by driving them through dense heathland and along sandy tracks at high speeds.Both this area of land and land on the other side of Red Road, used by the Army for rifle and high- explosive missle target practice,are surrounded by danger signs.They are classified as Restricted Areas by the MoD and should not be entered by members of the public.
